thread.title: Watch: Canby High School choir sings hymn in tribute to Oregon shooting victims
thread.title_full: Watch: Canby High School choir sings hymn in tribute to Oregon shooting victims | OregonLive.com

author: Jessica Greif | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Watch: Canby High School choir sings hymn in tribute to Oregon shooting victims
text:
Canby High School choir director Brooks Gingerich says before rehearsal Friday he was trying to think of ways his students could relate to the words in the hymn "Be Still, My Soul."
Then he thought of the victims of the Umpqua Community College shooting.
"It occurred to me that the text was extremely significant to the perspective of the victims' families," Gingerich said.
In what Gingerich said was a spur-of-the-moment idea, he then asked the choir to connect to that perspective and if the members would be willing to dedicate the song to those affected by the Roseburg tragedy.
"The music then took on a whole new intensity and meaning. I could tell the kids recognized that," he said.
Since the choir's rendition of the hymn was posted on the group's YouTube channel the day after the shooting, the clip has been viewed more than 11,000 times.
Gingerich said he's glad the video has been well-received but prefers the focus to remain on the victims.
-- Jessica Greif
jgreif@oregonian.com
@JessicaDGreif
